did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Civilian Conservation Corps and Family Photograph Collection, 1925, 1936, n.d.
did.abstract: The collection includes CCC photographs from camps (at least some are in Virginia), as well as a number of family photographs. Most items are not dated, but some images come from the 1920s and 1930s.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Civilian Conservation Corps and Family Photograph Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Civilian Conservation Corps and Family Photograph Collection, Ms2013-073, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Civilian Conservation Corps and Family Photograph Collection was acquired by Special Collections prior to 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Civilian Conservation Corps and Family Photograph Collection was completed in September 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes CCC photographs from camps (at least some are in Virginia), as well as a number of family photographs. Most of the photographs are not identified or dated, though some have notes on the edges. Those items with dates come from the 1920s and 1930s.

Photographs from the CCC camps include barracks, landscapes, and groups and individuals at work and leisure activities. Several photographs are identifed as CCC Camp P-57 in Hot Springs, Virignia; locations around Covington, Virginia; and locations around Bald Knob in West Virginia. The majority of the candid family and individual photographs are unidentified, though some have handwritten notes around the edges.
